intro: Varronia braceliniae, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright purple berries that are a striking feature, often used in ornamental gardening. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a slightly waxy texture. Varronia braceliniae thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
